sentiment_score_definition: x <= -0.35: Bearish; -0.35 < x <= -0.15: Somewhat-Bearish; -0.15 < x < 0.15: Neutral; 0.15 <= x < 0.35: Somewhat_Bullish; x >= 0.35: Bullish
relevance_score_definition: 0 < x <= 1, with a higher score indicating higher relevance.

feed.title: New Fairfield community rings 21-acre lake with homes from mid-$600Ks
feed.summary: Century Communities (NYSE: CCS) is opening a new neighborhood called Sunflower at One Lake in Fairfield, CA, where homes will start from the mid-$600,000s. The community features two-story homes with 3–5 bedrooms and access to a 21-acre recreational lake, parks, trails, and a clubhouse. A grand opening event will be held on Saturday, February 28, 2026, offering tours of furnished model homes and limited-time savings.

feed.title: Humana Statement on our Contract with Moffitt Health System
feed.summary: Humana announced that Moffitt Health System and Moffitt Cancer Center in Florida will be out-of-network for Humana Medicare Advantage members starting July 1, 2026. The company is committed to helping members transition to other in-network providers, particularly those undergoing treatment, and has established a customer support line for assistance. Emergency services will remain covered at the in-network benefit level regardless of hospital network participation.

feed.title: Sameer Gaur, pres. at Wabtec, sells $302k in stock
feed.summary: Sameer Gaur, President, Global Freight Services at Westinghouse Air Brake Technologies (WAB), sold 1,150 shares of company stock for approximately $302,015. This transaction occurred as WAB shares traded near their 52-week high, with the company recently reporting strong Q4 2025 financial results. Despite the positive earnings, InvestingPro analysis suggests WAB is currently overvalued.

feed.title: Assessing Raymond James Financial (RJF) Valuation After Recent Cooling In Short Term Share Momentum
feed.summary: Raymond James Financial (RJF) has experienced mixed share performance recently, with a short-term decline despite stronger longer-term returns, prompting a valuation assessment. The company appears undervalued, with an intrinsic discount of approximately 35% compared to its stock price, and a fair value estimated at $184.83. This undervaluation is supported by strategic investments in AI, robust loan growth in its banking segment, and high credit quality, though market uncertainties and slower asset growth pose risks.

feed.title: Is Motorola Solutions (MSI) Pricing In Too Much After Strong Multi‑Year Share Gains?
feed.summary: Motorola Solutions (MSI) has seen significant share gains, closing at US$471.95, and its valuation is being assessed. Both a Discounted Cash Flow (DCF) analysis and a Price-to-Earnings (P/E) ratio comparison suggest the stock may be overvalued. The DCF model estimates an intrinsic value of $379.88 per share, indicating the current price is about 24.2% higher, while its current P/E of 36.30x is above its calculated Fair Ratio of 26.30x.

feed.title: A Look At First American Financial (FAF) Valuation After Strong Q4 Growth And Analyst Outlook Upgrades
feed.summary: First American Financial (FAF) has shown strong Q4 growth, with adjusted revenue and EPS increasing significantly, driven by commercial revenue growth and improved operating leverage. The company's shares are up year-to-date, trading at $68.29 against an average analyst target of $79.40. While a narrative fair value suggests a 13.3% undervaluation at $78.80, its P/E ratio is slightly above peers but below the US insurance industry average, presenting a mixed signal for investors.

feed.title: Host Hotels And Resorts HST Q4 FFO Strength Tests Bearish Earnings Decline Narrative
feed.summary: Host Hotels & Resorts (HST) reported Q4 2025 revenues of US$1.6 billion and FFO of US$340 million, with basic EPS rising from US$0.15 to US$0.20. Despite this strength and a 9.8% earnings increase year-over-year, analysts forecast a 7.8% decline in EPS over the next three years. The article discusses how these strong recent results challenge the bearish outlook, though a one-off US$167 million gain complicates the underlying earnings trend.

feed.title: Assessing West Pharmaceutical Services (WST) Valuation As Mixed Returns Contrast With Diverging Fair Value Estimates
feed.summary: West Pharmaceutical Services (WST) has shown mixed stock returns recently, prompting a re-evaluation of its valuation. While an analyst narrative suggests the stock is 26.4% undervalued with a fair value of $338.57 due to growth in GLP-1s and high-margin components, a discounted cash flow (DCF) model indicates it is overvalued at $102.89. Investors are encouraged to consider these diverging fair value estimates and personal risk tolerance when assessing the stock.

feed.title: Cintas Awards Highlight Management Strength While Valuation And Debt Draw Scrutiny
feed.summary: Cintas (NasdaqGS:CTAS) has recently been recognized as one of America's best-managed companies and a top large employer for 2026, highlighting its corporate governance and workforce practices. While these awards indicate strong management, the article notes that Cintas's shares trade above Simply Wall St's estimated fair value and pose a risk due to a high level of debt. Investors are advised to consider these factors, alongside the company's P/E ratio, when evaluating Cintas.

feed.title: Five Below Coming To The Marketplace At Warsaw Fall 2026
feed.summary: Five Below is set to open a new location at the Marketplace in Warsaw this fall, occupying a nearly 10,000-square-foot space between Bealls and Ollie's Outlet. This opening, along with a future Hobby Lobby, will significantly increase the shopping center's occupancy from 14% to almost 90%, according to John Murphy of Sullivan Wickley. The city of Warsaw and Mayor Jeff Grose were thanked for their support in revitalizing the Marketplace.

feed.title: Judge Dismisses Man’s Disability Discrimination Suit Against Apple
feed.summary: A Los Angeles Superior Court judge has dismissed a lawsuit filed by Robert Bailey against Apple Inc. Bailey alleged disability discrimination, retaliation, and failure to accommodate after being terminated at age 79. The judge ruled that Apple provided a legitimate business reason for the termination, stating Bailey violated policy by initiating an account recovery request on a customer's behalf, and there was no evidence of discrimination.

feed.title: Lululemon founder says board's response to his suggestions 'weak and insufficient'
feed.summary: Lululemon founder Chip Wilson is escalating his pressure on the company's board, stating their response to his suggestions for board changes and a brand product committee was "weak and insufficient." Lululemon, however, claims they have engaged in good faith and that Wilson has prevented them from interviewing his director nominees. Wilson, a significant shareholder, is pushing for changes due to the company's declining stock value, CEO succession issues, and struggles with recruiting new board members.

feed.title: Next Generation Handheld Raman Analyzer
feed.summary: Thermo Fisher Scientific has introduced the new TruScan G3 Handheld Raman Analyzer, designed for portable raw material identification in the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries. This device allows for quick, non-destructive identity testing of materials, even through sealed packaging, thereby reducing the need for traditional lab testing. Key features include a built-in touchscreen, improved sensor performance, updated compound libraries, an immersion probe for in situ testing, and enhanced connectivity for data compliance.

feed.title: Quest Diagnostics stock reaches all-time high at 213.21 USD
feed.summary: Quest Diagnostics (DGX) stock has reached a new all-time high of $213.35, demonstrating a 25.34% return over the last year and a 22.21% year-to-date performance. Despite this achievement, InvestingPro analysis suggests the stock may be overvalued. Recent positive developments include exceeding Q4 2025 earnings and revenue expectations, and the appointment of Benjamin Beauvalot as Senior Vice President, Chief Strategy and M&A Officer.

feed.title: DTE Energy to seek another electric rate increase after $242 million hike
feed.summary: DTE Energy plans to seek another electricity rate increase in Michigan, just days after the Michigan Public Service Commission approved a $242 million hike. Attorney General Dana Nessel criticized the system for allowing utilities to request frequent increases, while DTE argues that investments improve reliability and keep bills relatively low. A proposed bill aims to extend the period between rate increase applications to three years, but utilities like Consumers Energy contend that annual adjustments help manage costs more effectively.

feed.title: What brewery workers are up against: The international operations of Molson Coors and Anheuser-Busch
feed.summary: The article discusses the brewing labor struggles against Molson Coors and Anheuser-Busch, highlighting their global operations, automation efforts, and financial strategies. It argues that workers need an international, rank-and-file led strategy to counter these powerful multinational corporations, emphasizing the commonality of struggles across industries like logistics and auto manufacturing.

feed.title: Zacks Industry Outlook Highlights Costco Wholesale, Ross Stores, Target and Dollar General
feed.summary: The Retail – Discount Stores industry continues to thrive by focusing on value and efficiency, attracting consumers amidst inflationary pressures. Key trends include resilient consumer spending, a sustained search for bargains, enhanced omnichannel capabilities, and disciplined margin management. Zacks Investment Research highlights Costco Wholesale Corp., Ross Stores, Inc., Target Corp., and Dollar General Corp. as leading companies in this sector, each showing strategic strengths in their market positions and financial outlooks.

feed.title: NetApp Posts Record All-Flash Revenue Amid Soaring Memory Prices
feed.summary: NetApp reported record all-flash storage revenue in its Q3 fiscal 2026, reaching $1.0 billion despite widespread memory price inflation. The company is actively managing these price increases through pricing adjustments, supplier engagement, and a diverse product portfolio. Additionally, AI is becoming a significant growth driver, with NetApp securing nearly 300 AI customer wins and seeing strong early momentum for its AFX and AI Data Engine solutions.

feed.title: Merck to lay off around 150 employees at US site amid slump in Gardasil sales
feed.summary: Merck is set to lay off approximately 150 employees at its North Carolina facility, which produces the HPV vaccine Gardasil, in response to a significant slump in sales. The company attributed this downturn to weak demand in China, leading to a 39% decrease in global sales in 2025, and a recent change in U.S. immunization recommendations for the vaccine. Merck's management has indicated that Gardasil is no longer considered a key growth driver.

feed.title: Further weakness as Rapid7 (NASDAQ:RPD) drops 5.0% this week, taking three-year losses to 29%
feed.summary: Rapid7 Inc. (NASDAQ:RPD) shares have fallen 5.0% this past week, contributing to a 29% loss over the last three years, underperforming the market, despite impressive revenue growth of 22% per year over the same period. While the company is not yet profitable, its strong revenue growth might indicate a potential buying opportunity for investors who believe the previous share price may have overvalued future growth. Analysts have provided forecasts, suggesting investors should review consensus estimates for future profit levels.

feed.title: Will more Kroger stores close in Illinois? Here's what we know so far
feed.summary: Kroger is continuing with its plan to close 60 stores nationwide by the end of 2026, with two Houston-area stores scheduled for April closures. The company states these closures, which involve approximately 1,000 layoffs, are aimed at increasing efficiency and ensuring long-term business health. One Illinois store in Peoria is already slated for closure in August 2026, and a list of other affected stores across several states has been released, though Kroger has not disclosed further closure plans for the Midwest.

feed.title: Ready Capital Corp Reports Mixed Q4 Results Amid Real Estate Sec
feed.summary: Ready Capital Corp (RC) reported mixed Q4 2023 results, with GAAP earnings per share of $0.12 and distributable earnings per share of $0.26, amidst challenges in the commercial real estate sector. The company achieved a net income of $10.88 million and saw total assets increase to $12.44 billion, while strategically avoiding office collateral to mitigate market risks. Despite sector headwinds, Ready Capital declared a dividend of $0.30 per common share, reflecting resilience and a focus on core lending strategies.

feed.title: Kroger closures continue, but it's unclear how it will affect Kentucky stores
feed.summary: Kroger is continuing its plan to close approximately 60 locations nationwide by the end of 2026, with two stores in Houston scheduled for April 10 closures. While the company stated these closures are to increase efficiency and ensure long-term business health, leading to about 1,000 employee layoffs, it remains unclear how many additional Kentucky stores might be affected beyond the one already identified in Louisville. Kroger has not disclosed which other stores it plans to close, and a spokesperson was unaware of additional closures in the Midwest since June 2025.

feed.title: Nuveen Municipal Credit Income Fund (NZF) sees tiny offsetting insider trades
feed.summary: Bank of America Corporation and its subsidiary, Merrill Lynch, Pierce, Fenner & Smith Incorporated, reported small, offsetting indirect trades of Nuveen Municipal Credit Income Fund (NZF) common stock. On February 25, 2026, they purchased 8 shares at $12.8784 and sold 8 shares at $12.965, resulting in zero shares held indirectly from these transactions. The reporting persons disclaim beneficial ownership except for pecuniary interest and state that any recoverable profit under Section 16(b) will be remitted to the fund.

feed.title: Westinghouse Air Brake Technologies Insider Sold Shares Worth $302,016, According to a Recent SEC Filing
feed.summary: An insider at Westinghouse Air Brake Technologies Corporation (NYSE: WAB) recently sold shares valued at $302,016, as disclosed in a new SEC filing. The company, a leading supplier of technological equipment, systems, and services for the transportation sector, specializes in products like locomotives, braking systems, and transit equipment. Westinghouse Air Brake Technologies reported net sales spanning various regions, with a significant portion from the United States, and anticipates its Q1 2026 earnings release around April 28.

feed.title: NetApp, Inc. (NASDAQ:NTAP) Plans Quarterly Dividend of $0.52
feed.summary: NetApp, Inc. (NASDAQ:NTAP) announced a quarterly dividend of $0.52 per share, with an ex-dividend date of April 2nd and payment on April 22nd. This follows an earnings beat where the company reported $2.12 EPS against an expected $2.07 and raised its guidance for both Q4 and FY26, attributing growth to demand for AI-ready infrastructure. Despite the positive financial results and dividend announcement, shares traded down on below-average volume, suggesting investor concerns about valuation and the transition risks associated with its shift towards AI-focused cloud subscription offerings.

feed.title: Altria Group, Inc. Declares Quarterly Dividend of $1.06 (NYSE:MO)
feed.summary: Altria Group (NYSE:MO) has declared a quarterly dividend of $1.06 per share, payable on April 30th to shareholders of record on March 25th. The company has a strong dividend history, raising it for 56 consecutive years, and analysts expect its earnings to continue covering the $4.24 annual dividend. Institutional investors hold a significant portion of Altria Group's stock, with several major firms increasing their positions in recent quarters.

feed.title: Globe Life Inc. (NYSE:GL) Declares Quarterly Dividend of $0.33
feed.summary: Globe Life Inc. (NYSE:GL) has declared a quarterly dividend of $0.33 per share, marking a 22.2% increase from its previous dividend. The company has a strong dividend history, having raised its dividend annually for the past 20 years, with a conservative payout ratio of 7.2%. Despite a slight earnings per share miss in the last quarter, Globe Life provided positive FY2026 EPS guidance, and analysts expect continued dividend coverage.

feed.title: Lilly and Incyte’s Olumiant Recommended in EU for Adolescents with Severe Alopecia Areata
feed.summary: Eli Lilly and Company’s Olumiant (baricitinib), a Janus kinase (JAK) inhibitor, has received a positive recommendation in Europe for treating severe alopecia areata in adolescents aged 12 to 18. This recommendation, based on Phase III trial data showing significant hair regrowth, follows its 2022 approval for adults in both Europe and the U.S. A final decision from the European Commission is anticipated within one to two months, offering a potential new treatment option for a vulnerable patient population.

feed.title: 3 Airline Stocks to Buy Before Travel Season
feed.summary: The U.S. airline sector is projected to achieve a record-breaking $41 billion in net profit in 2026, despite challenges like razor-thin profit margins and rising operating costs. This article highlights three airline stocks—American Airlines, Delta Air Lines, and United Airlines—that are poised for growth due to strategic business moves, analyst upgrades, and increasing travel demand heading into the spring and summer seasons.

feed.title: MUFG continues to strategically invest in Leveraged Credit business with key new hire
feed.summary: MUFG has strengthened its Leveraged Credit business with the addition of Jordan Hollander as a Director on the High Yield Credit Research team. Hollander brings extensive experience from both the buy-side and sell-side, previously working at Legal & General Investment Management, Deutsche Bank, and Jefferies. This strategic hire, along with recent appointments to the Leveraged Credit Distribution team, underscores MUFG's commitment to expanding its capabilities in sales and trading to better serve its issuer and investor clients.

feed.title: Insider plans sale of 54,792 AMGN shares (NASDAQ: AMGN)
feed.summary: A Form 144 filing indicates an insider's proposed sale of 54,792 Amgen (NASDAQ: AMGN) common shares. These shares originate from two equity compensation grants dated 2017 and 2018. The proposed transactions, dated February 26, 2026, are described as cash sales, with the filing providing public notice of the intent to sell rather than confirming completed transactions.

feed.title: Marcus & Millichap Brokers $9.8M Sale of Shopping Center in Hampton, Georgia
feed.summary: Marcus & Millichap has brokered the $9.8 million sale of Centre at Lovejoy, a 46,700-square-foot shopping center in Hampton, Georgia. The property was sold by WRS Inc. to New York-based AGW Partners and was part of a larger two-property portfolio sale. Centre at Lovejoy is shadow-anchored by Walmart and was 100% leased to 17 tenants, including Bank of America, GameStop, and Dollar Tree at the time of sale.

feed.title: McDonald's evolution from drive-in to global fast-food icon
feed.summary: This article chronicles the transformation of McDonald's from its beginnings as a drive-in restaurant founded by the McDonald brothers in 1940 to its current status as a global fast-food empire. It highlights key milestones such as the introduction of the "Speedee Service System," Ray Kroc's involvement in franchising, and the development of its iconic design and menu items like the Big Mac and Happy Meal. Today, McDonald's operates in 119 countries with over 35,000 restaurants, continuing to innovate, as evidenced by its new spin-off, CosMc's.

feed.title: [Form 4] WESTINGHOUSE AIR BRAKE TECHNOLOGIES CORP Insider Trading Activity
feed.summary: Sameer Gaur, President of Global Freight Services at Westinghouse Air Brake Technologies Corp (WAB), reported the sale of 1,150 shares of WAB common stock on February 26, 2026. The transaction occurred at a weighted average price of $262.6223 per share, with individual trades ranging from $262.605 to $262.65. Following this sale, Gaur's direct holdings in Wabtec common shares stand at 12,017.

feed.title: Dell’s Q4 Hits Records: Guidance Raises FY27 Forecast
feed.summary: Dell Technologies reported record-breaking Q4 FY26 results, with revenue of $33.4B and adjusted EPS of $3.89, largely driven by strong demand for AI-optimized servers. The company provided optimistic FY27 guidance, projecting revenues between $138B and $142B and an AI-related revenue target of $50B, backed by innovations like the PowerEdge XR9700 and strategic partnerships. Management's confidence is further underscored by a 20% dividend increase and a $10B share repurchase program aimed at enhancing stakeholder value.

feed.title: Capital One Financial Corp Stock Moved Down by 6.20% on Feb 27: Key Drivers Unveiled
feed.summary: Capital One Financial Corp (COF) saw its stock decline by 6.20% on February 27, driven by a combination of factors including a miss on Q4 2025 earnings expectations, significant insider and institutional selling, and negative analyst sentiment. Concerns over the Discover acquisition, potential regulatory changes, and an ongoing lawsuit also contributed to the downward pressure. Technical indicators like MACD suggested a sell signal for the stock.

feed.title: Amazon Plans In-House AI Chips to Cut Costs
feed.summary: Amazon (AMZN) intends to utilize its proprietary Trainium and Inferentia processors for developing artificial intelligence models. This move aims to significantly reduce costs associated with AI technology development, as revealed in a Wall Street Journal report, and is part of a broader strategy to gain more control over its AI technology stack and manage expenses for large-scale model training and deployment. The company plans to dedicate a substantial portion of its $200 billion capital expenditure in 2026 towards AI, processors, and related infrastructure.

feed.title: NYSE Content Update: Grindr Reports 28% Full Year Revenue Growth in Q4 Earnings
feed.summary: The New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) released its daily pre-market update, highlighting mixed stock performance as investors reacted to economic data and Federal Reserve comments. Grindr (NYSE: GRND) reported a 28% increase in full-year revenue for 2025 following its Q4 earnings release. This update also mentions upcoming NYSE Live appearances and bell-ringing ceremonies.

feed.title: JLL’s Capital Markets team completes sale of 216,000 SF 8A industrial warehouse
feed.summary: JLL Capital Markets has successfully arranged the sale of a 216,000-square-foot industrial warehouse at 152 Ridge Road in South Brunswick Township, New Jersey, to Invesco Real Estate. The property, fully leased to a third-party logistics company, is located in the strong-performing Exit 8A market. JLL's team highlighted the continued demand, rent growth, and absorption rates in the New Jersey industrial market.

feed.title: Huge grocery store chain closing 60 stores nationwide
feed.summary: Kroger, a major grocery store chain, is in the process of closing 60 stores nationwide, a plan initially announced in June 2025. While 30 stores have already been shuttered across several states, none of these closures have affected Michigan, where Kroger operates 121 stores. The company states these closures target underperforming locations to improve long-term financial health.

feed.title: Sanofi (SNY) and Regeneron (REGN) Gain EMA Nod for Dupixent Expa
feed.summary: Sanofi and Regeneron have received a positive recommendation from the European Medicines Agency (EMA) for the expanded use of Dupixent (dupilumab) to treat chronic spontaneous urticaria in children aged two to 11. This decision, backed by phase 3 LIBERTY-CUPID trial data, targets children who haven't responded to standard antihistamine treatments. Sanofi's financial health is strong with robust margins and a low debt-to-equity ratio, though its Altman Z-Score suggests potential financial challenges.

feed.title: MNST: Wells Fargo Raises Price Target for Monster Beverage | MNS
feed.summary: Wells Fargo has reaffirmed its "Overweight" rating for Monster Beverage (MNST) and increased its price target from $86.00 to $94.00, reflecting continued confidence in the company. This follows several other analysts who have also raised their price targets for MNST in recent weeks. Despite these positive analyst actions, GuruFocus estimates suggest a slight downside in the stock's GF Value compared to its current price.

feed.title: Former Optum CEO leaving UnitedHealth
feed.summary: Heather Cianfrocco, former CEO of Optum and a long-time executive at UnitedHealth Group, is departing the company. She served UnitedHealth Group for 24 years, with her most recent role being executive vice president of governance, compliance, and information security.

feed.title: Michigan Strategic Fund board OKs incentives for solar component site in Saginaw County
feed.summary: The Michigan Strategic Fund board has approved significant incentives for Corning Inc. to build a $900 million solar component manufacturing facility in Saginaw County, Michigan. This project is expected to create 1,151 jobs with competitive wages and benefits and is a key step in strengthening the domestic solar supply chain. Corning chose Michigan due to its local workforce and proximity to Hemlock Semiconductor, despite offers from other states.

feed.title: Here’s Why Prudential Insiders Are Buying the Dip While Japan Sales Are Frozen
feed.summary: Despite a misconduct scandal in Japan leading to a voluntary sales halt and a $300-$350 million earnings hit, Prudential Financial (PRU) insiders have been actively buying shares, signaling confidence in the company's long-term value. The company's core financial engine remains strong, with $6.6 billion in pretax adjusted operating income and growing ROE, alongside strategic shifts towards asset management, retirement solutions, and private credit to secure future growth. While Wall Street maintains a cautious stance with a modest upside target, TIKR's valuation model suggests a higher return, contingent on the swift resolution of the Japan issue and sustained growth in its new strategic areas.

feed.title: Coca-Cola (NYSE: KO) CFO sells 99,437 shares and receives 226,595 options
feed.summary: Coca-Cola President and CFO John Murphy received a grant of 226,595 employee stock options on February 26, 2026. Prior to this, on February 25, 2026, he exercised 99,437 options at $40.89 per share and subsequently sold the same number of shares at a weighted average price of $80.4181. After these transactions, Murphy directly holds 410,550 Coca-Cola shares, with additional indirect holdings.

feed.title: Boss Energy expands global uranium footprint with Alta Mesa project
feed.summary: Boss Energy (ASX: BOE) has completed a $92 million acquisition of a 30% stake in the Alta Mesa in situ recovery (ISR) uranium project in South Texas from enCore Energy, marking a significant step in its global expansion. This move diversifies Boss Energy's production geographically and adds to its growing uranium inventory, complementing its Honeymoon uranium project in South Australia. The Alta Mesa project has a central processing plant with a capacity of 1.5 million pounds of uranium per year and historically produced nearly 5Mlb of uranium.

feed.title: Synopsys Q1 FY 2026 Earnings Highlight EDA and Ansys Momentum
feed.summary: Synopsys reported strong Q1 FY 2026 earnings, with revenues at $2.409 billion, exceeding guidance, driven by AI-focused Design Automation and a significant contribution from Ansys. The company's strategic focus on AI-driven engineering workflows and system-to-silicon integration is amplifying its competitive advantage, despite a transitional phase for its Design IP revenue. Synopsys reaffirmed its full-year revenue guidance and raised non-GAAP EPS guidance, signaling confidence in its AI infrastructure role.

feed.title: Cisco Systems Unusual Options Activity For February 27
feed.summary: Investors have taken a mixed stance on Cisco Systems (NASDAQ: CSCO), with options trading showing both bullish and bearish sentiment. Benzinga's options scanner detected 10 uncommon options trades, indicating that whales are targeting a price range between $67.5 and $100.0 for CSCO. The company's stock is currently trading at $78.39, with analysts providing a consensus target price of $97.5.
